website_summaries.verdict: A small, easy-to-use woodworking lathe with a few limitations typical for smaller lathes. Its minor flaws are balanced by a customer service department that backs this product well.
pros: Fast shipping and good packaging were important pluses for many users
The unit is a step up from starter lathes with variable speed selection
Good customer service, with defective parts replaced quickly
cons: Limited in the size of items that can be turned on the lathe
Some misalignment in the spindle reported

customer_reviews.title: Top notch machine.
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using a cheap Harbor Freight lathe for years until I was able to save for this. It's worth every penny. Zero vibration without being bolted down. No tools needed for belt changes. Live centers. Perfect alignment. Quiet. Loads of available accessories. The variable speed works like a charm. Larger clearance than most comparable models. I've been using it almost every day for months and it performs perfectly. Can't ask for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip M.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: The lathe itself is pretty decent for what it is, although the tool rest post snapped clean off. I reached out to (Tools Plus Outlet - Established 1980). But no reply. That is the main reason for a 1 star rating. Products can have defects, but when the seller has defects, that's where I draw the line.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: A skookum little choocher
customer_reviews.text: While I have a tendency of leaving 5 star reviews for the products I like, I really love this little lathe. I put it through its paces in the 1st month of usage. Fully planned on beating it to death while still under warranty. Now, this is my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Palange

customer_reviews.title: Great lathe with all the bells and whistles!
customer_reviews.text: This lathe is excellent, not too big but heavy 80 pounds. The motor runs quiet, and the reverse switch is a plus. The instructions are good, has tons of accessories that you can put on it. The belt can be easily changed to low torque, and high speed, medium torque, and medium speed, and high torque and low speed. The variable speed switch is another plus. Can't think of anything bad on this lathe. Will start turning pens soon!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio C. Dasilva

customer_reviews.title: Worth every nickle and then some ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering buying anything other than the Comet II don't do it, you'll be sorry if you do. This is the lathe you want. Superior quality, feature packed, plenty of power, easy to use, and the variable speed control...WOW is it awesome. Makes turning a dream and at this point all of the scrap wood has been used up and there is no piece of wood in the house that is safe from being glued up and turned into something else. Love the Comet II and happy as can be that I bought this lathe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great lathe for the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: got here on time set up is Easy ,lots of info on Y tube ,Do take the time to break in the motor and VFD. very Quite about the same foot print as my mini Rikon lathe witch I have been very happy with just needed more speed control when finishing. Seams well built I would have rather had a spot for a wrench on the arbor instead of index pin for removing the chuck, all though seams to work just fine. Update 2020 still love my Nova lathe very quiet do most of my Turing at night have got no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Wade A. Howe

customer_reviews.title: Great starter lathe.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect lathe for someone starting out in wood turning. I couldn't be happier with the product. I'm able to produce all kinds of projects from simple pens, bottle stoppers to medium sized bowls (12" diameter max). Plenty of power. The variable speed is extremely helpful. Even portable if required.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Its good except
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the so called ability to have a sharpening station right at the lathe , but none of those things where even close to working. As far as turning goes the late is fine and have no complaints as of now , but wish I would of bought another lathe since the reasons I choose this one was flawed
customer_reviews.author: John A Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the packaging and delivery time. My NOVA seems well built and easy to operate. I have turned a few bowls out of popular and walnut types of wood and did not notice any problems with this product. Since I have not had this that long I cant give it 5 stars as I want to see how long it lasts. Overall, so far, good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Harris

customer_reviews.title: Delivery company employees do not follow direction printed on the box.
customer_reviews.text: Box delivered stand-in on the end. It is a gift an I have not opened it yet. The box clearly is marked "Top Not Stand On End" Not sure of damage at this stage. Product good delivery is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, dependable midi lathe
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, intact, and almost ready to use. I bought this to replace my Rockler Excelsior lathe and so far I've been very happy with the Nova. This lathe has variable speed control, a reverse feature, and the ability to turn up to 12" diameter bowls. These are the reasons I decided to upgrade to this lathe over the Excelsior (which in my opinion is also a good lathe).
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: A great machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lathe I have ever used! It is so quiet compaired to other lathes, even better than a Jet.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dobeck

customer_reviews.title: Great mid sized lathe
customer_reviews.text: This little lathe is great. Variable speed and reverse work well. I build my own stand using 2 x 8 lumber for about $50 including hardware. I've turned about 8 bowls with it since purchase no problems.
customer_reviews.author: David Buckbee

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for a hassle
customer_reviews.text: Only used this product twice, seemed okay but customer service is terrible. It seems they are confused. Had a terrible time getting the warranty submitted, finally I told them to just forget it. Like they don’t trust you for a $400 purchase. You think you had purchased a $3000.00 lathe. If the rest of the warranty repair is like this it is not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lathe as I am just starting to learn how ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lathe as I am just starting to learn how to turn. Variable speed is great, helps to know what speed in good to use on different woods and what you are tuning. The only thing is that I wish it was bigger for wider bowls. But it is fantastic to learn on, I will have lathe this for quite, Really fun to use. The only problem I have is once and a while I pinch my fingers when changing the belt on the pulley. NOT the machine's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Thomas

customer_reviews.title: First lathe
customer_reviews.text: My first lathe of my own and probably much more than for just a beginner. Already bought many add ons and relax making man glitter (saw dust). A perfect machine to take the edge off your nerves and some blocks of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: ... been using this 8 months and it is a great machine. Small annoyances are the long threaded belt ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this 8 months and it is a great machine. Small annoyances are the long threaded belt cover screw, the hinge screw comes loose over time and has to be checked periodically. The stock tool rest is really soft and will get dinged up quickly. None of these are a deal breaker I upgraded my tool rest. You can easily turn 10 inch bowls and 16 inch spindles with this. It is very quiet and came well packaged with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: allen mayles

customer_reviews.title: Tool rest broke with the first catch
customer_reviews.text: I bought one from Woodcraft and two more from Amazon for my woodturning club. A member was using it today for the first time and had a catch and the rest broke where the post connected to the crossbar. The knob on the quill rattled like crazy, we put a washer at the bottom of the knob and it fixed the rattle. Otherwise I think this is good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Amarant

customer_reviews.title: excellent lathe
customer_reviews.text: very impressed with overall product and shipping times. relatively no assembly required, just the motor break-in time which was very simple. have made several items with this lathe and could not be more happy with every aspect. Expect 1000 of hours of this quality product
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Broken part.
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed,plastic belt shield was broken. Other than that all looks good. Can this part be replaced without returning the entire unit
customer_reviews.author: Neil Cridge

customer_reviews.title: Very fine purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Like all Nova products, this lathe offers more in value than I expected. It makes turning a real joy!
customer_reviews.author: James Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Received Nova Comet 11-Mini Lathe with out delay discovered it had American power source not compatable with Australian power source. Now have a Lathe I can not use. Very disappointed with Amazon for importing such an item.
customer_reviews.author: kevin hoad

customer_reviews.title: Only one Issue
customer_reviews.text: This is my first lathe to own. I have used a number of other lathes and this one is in the top. It is very quiet and smooth. Speed settings are easy to change. Perfect for all my projects. The only thing I have had a problem with is the main pulley loosened up and started making a funny noise. This was an easy fix with only one screw.
customer_reviews.author: cody hatten

customer_reviews.title: Damaged!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a damaged package but what I received had damage to the lathe itself. The belt cover was cracked and scratches to the front. Also the quill bar was bent. The lathe itself runs good.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi G

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the tool size.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the size. Not your heavy duty stand alone machine. While the motor is variable speed, you will still need to change the belts for better control.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Favor

customer_reviews.title: Very good lathe, no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Love this lathe, so glad I bought it. Love all the options you can do with it and the speed control is a big bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just what I was looking for. It if of great quality.
customer_reviews.author: K.Cormier

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The variable speed is great for being able to use the correct speed for each activity when turning without any hassle. The machine is well made very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: CNC Hobbiest

customer_reviews.title: Nova comet II
customer_reviews.text: Very Happy quit and a work horse. Packaged very well can tell they pride in there product.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Franka

customer_reviews.title: Great first lathe for my son
customer_reviews.text: Great first lathe for my son. Got it at a great price. Nova customer service was great with answering some questions before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: toad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is really enjoying this! It seems to be a very good wood turner.
customer_reviews.author: Rotatiller

customer_reviews.title: Great little lathe
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying a lathe. I Almost bought a jet 1221. I just couldn’t get past the price difference with the same features. I’m not disappointed as this lathe has not disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Clifford

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent starter lathe
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent starter lathe. It worked perfectly for a couple months, and then developed some bearing problems, but they replaced the entire unit under warranty. You'll never meet a better customer service rep than Andrew. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S. Conger

customer_reviews.title: Nova Comet II VIBRATION excessive.
customer_reviews.text: After 30 minute break in run, vibration excessive. Belt adjustment mechanism JAMMED from factory. you're on your own folks.
customer_reviews.author: scotty

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Has handled everything that I have wanted to do. Top quality and very easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Boydman

customer_reviews.title: Question on hand wheel, is it damaged?
customer_reviews.text: This is my first wood lathe and very pleased with the performance and quality.I have one questions: The lathe seems to work well, I noticed the LHB Hand Wheel /Break seems to turn out of round. Do not know how to adjust? My only concern is I want to purchase grinding attachments will this be a problem?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from one that I bought at auction.... This thing is awesome!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nova  lathe
customer_reviews.text: Easy to transport. Our club teaches woodturning classes to kids at the Rec-Center. The size of the lathe makes it great for classes and demos. Also works well as a second lathe in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I expected & it does it very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this lathe!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this nova comet ll lathe!! It does everything I needed to do and more. Highly recommend this lathe to anybody looking for a good all-around midi lathe.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Binder

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This lathe does everything I expected it to do(so far!) No problems smooth running. look forward to the attachments
customer_reviews.author: Fen

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with with so far
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with with so far , variable speed and reversing mode sure gives a better sanding option of making the surface is smooth either direction . Changeing the belt on the pulleys a easy task and room for fingers . Seem very sound so far
customer_reviews.author: duane Kedish

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and no trouble
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great little lathe, does whatever I need done in turning small pieces. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Deran wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression is good despite broken parts upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well built but the packaging may could be improved. The belt cover was broken out of the box. Not the end of the world as a replacement is $8.50. Lathe seems to operate well. Smooth, vibration free. Centers aligned out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ward Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Lathe
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this lathe. I highly recommend this for anyone looking to do some woodturning.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Messenger

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Nice little lathe for a beginner. Have some minor issues with the tool rest, however not enough to give a bad rating.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kelham

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Like it a lot turned about 30 pens and 3 bowls each day is a new adventure
customer_reviews.author: Nick Hettinga

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this thing. Can't wait to have more time to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and
customer_reviews.text: just the right size for my projects. Nice and compact
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Montalto

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Runs smooth and quiet, everything on it works great. For the money, I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Williams

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of getting into wood working get a jet
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Love this lathe
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! No issues in the 4 weeks I have had this lathe.
customer_reviews.author: Simply Chic Homes

customer_reviews.title: I received my lathe and the box said it included ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my lathe and the box said it included the chuck and tools? Only the lathe was in the box? The box says it’s 43602
customer_reviews.author: Joe Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this lathe
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this lathe. Very little required for setup and was 'maken shavins' within the hour after opening the box. Very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cole

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT! It’s a great lathe so don’t listen to ...
customer_reviews.text: There are many negative comments about the lathe setup and directions. It could not have been EASIER! I had the lathe setup and running in about 15 minutes, NO damage, NO missing ANYTHING, PERFECT! It’s a great lathe so don’t listen to the other negative reviews. 5 Star!
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese garbage. Less than four hours on it and it quit working
customer_reviews.author: Todd P.

customer_reviews.title: very good packing and it works
customer_reviews.text: arrived quicker than expected, very good packing and it works!, excellent quality
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small shop
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my small shop . does not require a lot of room and the variable speeds is perfect for most turning needs.
customer_reviews.author: william adamson

customer_reviews.title: Nova Comet II
customer_reviews.text: So far this lathe has been great. I have turned a few pens, small bowls and an 11" plate. It has performed very well. The variable speed is outstanding and the reverse is optimal for smooth sanding. I am extremely pleased with my comet II!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Ordered one on 10/3..... gears ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one on 10/3.....gears grinding so it was returned for replacement. Replacement came and lasted a week.....motor issues. There won't be a 3rd time.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn F.

customer_reviews.title: The plastic levers on the tool rest lock, tail ...
customer_reviews.text: The plastic levers on the tool rest lock, tail stock lock and tail stock quill seem quite fragile. I am nervous about their durability.
customer_reviews.author: Bob D.

product_meta.title: Nova 71118 Comet II DR - Midi Lathe Flexible Woodworking System, 12”, Powerful Electronic 3/4 HP variable speed
product_meta.description:
Style:NEW Model

Small, space saving design means the NOVATM Comet II Midi Adaptable Lathe is a great choice for a multitude of projects. This Nova Lathe can be a primary or secondary lathe in a multifunctional workshop, and great for those who travel teach/demonstrate frequently. NOVA’s new lathe with a spin - make it your flexible woodworking system. It is the most versatile midi lathe in the market.

Exceptional Structural Strength – Solid Cast Iron construction throughout delivers optimum strength and rigidity while absorbing any vibration. The result, an exceptionally smooth turning experience with less time spent in the finishing process. 

3 Step Pulley System offers different speed ranges while providing maximum flexibility. The middle step usually provides enough range for most woodturning applications; however, the additional two steps provide more torque when needed for more demanding projects. 

NOVA Versaturn Adaptable Technology – its adaptability gives you so much more than just a Midi Lathe, with the use of the Versaturn Coupler Accessory, you can then attach additional accessories including a Grinding Wheel – no need to take an additional grinder when you travel to sharpen your tools.
feature_bullets: Speed Range: 250 - 4,000 RPM with its powerful electronic variable speed motor.
Digital Readout: Quickly dial-in the correct speed for the job, material and conditions. you’re not limited to potentially dangerous fixed-speed steps.
Forward and reverse switch: Forward and Reverse Switch offers additional ﬂexibility with the Nova Lathe and allows you to achieve a superior ﬁnish
12” Swing over bed and 16.5” between centers. Expandable to 42“ with optional bed extension accessory (Additional purchase).
3” Faceplate, 6” Tool Rest, Spur-Drive Center, Live Tailstock Center, Knockout Bar, Lathe Handwheel Unit. Manual with parts breakdown and fasteners.

specifications.Included Components: NOVA 71118 Wood Lathe, Comet II, 12 Inch, 3/4HP Variable Speed, Mini Lathe
specifications.Warranty Description: WARRANTY: 1-Year Motor and Controller 2-Years Mechanical and parts
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars149 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
